ibis.cashmere.constellation

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.cashmere.constellation.Device
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Device>

    public class Device
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Device>
    Class that represents a many-core Device.

    • Method Detail

      • getMemoryCapacity

        public long getMemoryCapacity()
        Get the memory capacity of this device.
        Returns:
        the capacity of this device in bytes.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Device device)
        Compares this device with Device device in terms of when a device can launch kernels.

        This method compares the number of kernel launches on a device to find out when a device is going to terminate.

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Device>
        Parameters:
        device - the device to compare against
        Returns:
        < 0 if this device is expected to terminate its kernels sooner than device, 0 if this device is expected to terminate its kernels at the same time as the other device, > 0 if this device is expected to terminate its kernels later than the other device.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the nickname of this device.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the nickname of this device.

      • allocate

        public org.jocl.Pointer allocate(long size)
        Allocates size bytes of memory on the device.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of bytes to allocate
        Returns:
        a Pointer to the memory on the device

      • copy

        public void copy(Buffer buffer,
                 Argument.Direction d)
        Copy a buffer to the device. After completion, the data has a representation on the host and on the device. This means that after a kernel execution updates the data, the host representation can be updated with a get(Buffer).
        Parameters:
        buffer - a Buffer to be copied to the device
        d - indicates the direction of the copied value (only for reading, only for writing, or for both)

      • copy

        public void copy(float[] a,
                 Argument.Direction d)
        Copy an array of floats to the device. After completion, the data has a representation on the host and on the device. This means that after a kernel execution updates the data, the host representation can be updated with a get(float[]).
        Parameters:
        a - a float array to be copied to the devie
        d - indicates the direction of the copied value (only for reading, only for writing, or for both)

      • copy

        public void copy(Buffer from,
                 org.jocl.Pointer to)
        Copy a buffer to memory on the device. Compared to copy(Buffer,Argument.Direction), this version is not coupled with from.
        Parameters:
        from - a Buffer to be copied to the device
        to - a Pointer representing the address of the memory to which is copied
